Package Model

Class Map

java.lang.Object
ObserverDP.Observable
Model.Map
public class Map extends Observable
Map is the class that defines the city map. A map is composed of:
  • A SortedMap of intersection ids and intersections (a TreeMap).
  • A tour.
Map is created when loading a map by parsing an XML map file. When loading a map, each intersection is added to the TreeMap with its id and the segments of road are saved in their respective intersection they are originated from.
Map inherits Observable class in order to repaint it more easily when it has been modified.
Author:
H4122
See Also:
Intersection, Segment, Tour, Controller.parseMap(org.w3c.dom.Document)

    • computeMapBoundaries

      public MapBoundaries computeMapBoundaries()
      Calculates the boundaries of this map that are:
      • The minimum latitude of all intersections latitude that composed this map.
      • The minimum longitude of all intersections longitude that composed this map.
      • The maximum latitude of all intersections latitude that composed this map.
      • The maximum longitude of all intersections longitude that composed this map.
      Returns:
      The boundaries of this map.
      See Also:
      Intersection, MapBoundaries

    • computeShortestPath

      public ArrayList<Path> computeShortestPath​(Stop dstop, ArrayList<Stop> listStop)
      Computes the shortest path from the given departure stop to each stop of the list in parameter. Uses an adaptation of Dijkstra algorithm: This method saves and updates the shortest distance between the departure stop and another intersection such as it was found until this iteration, and the predecessor of each intersection that corresponds to the distance found.
      First, distances are set to infinite and predecessors to null. All intersections of this map are set to WHITE (not visited yet). Departure stop is GREY (visited and in treatment). At each iteration, the algorithm selects a grey intersection and visits all its successors (the arrival intersection of its originated segments). If a shorter distance to reach the successor is found, distances predecessors are updated (release procedure). When the algorithm visits a new intersection, the latter is set to GREY. An intersection is set to BLACK when the algorithm has visited all its successors and so the shortest path to it has been found.
      The algorithm is completed when the shortest distance to reach all stops in the list has been found. Then the path from the departure stop to each stops is computed using predecessors list.
      Parameters:
      dstop - The stop from where the shortest paths must be originated.
      listStop - The list of stop to compute the shortest path to.
      Returns:
      The list of each shortest path from the departure stop to each stop of the list.
      See Also:
      getLowestDistanceIntersection(ArrayList, SortedMap), Intersection, Stop, Visited, Segment, Path

    • getLowestDistanceIntersection

      public Intersection getLowestDistanceIntersection​(ArrayList<Long> greyIntersection, SortedMap<Long,​Float> d)
      Finds the id of the intersection that has the lowest associated distance among a list of intersections.
      Parameters:
      greyIntersection - The list of ids of the intersections among which the lowest distance has to be found.
      d - The SortedMap of all intersection ids and corresponding distances.
      Returns:
      The id of the intersection that has the lowest distance.
      See Also:
      computeShortestPath(Stop, ArrayList), Intersection

    • containsStop

      public boolean containsStop​(ArrayList<Stop> listStop, Intersection i)
      Searches if the given list of stops contains a stop located on the intersection in parameter.
      Parameters:
      listStop - The list of stop to look into.
      i - The intersection to search in the list.
      Returns:
      TRUE if the list contains a stop located on the given intersection
      See Also:
      Intersection, Stop

    • addRequest

      public void addRequest() throws Exception
      Adds a request in the computed tour. Tests if the request and the predecessors of its stop are correct and consistent. Then adds the pickup stop and the delivery stop of the request at the right place in the computed tour, and updates the tour (new paths to and from new stop + recalculate the arrival times).
      The four stops needed are attributes of the tour.
      Throws:
      Exception - If the request or the predecessors are not valid.
      See Also:
      addStopInTour(int, Stop), Stop, Tour, Tour.getOrderedTravel(), Tour.computeArrivalTimes()

    • deleteRequest

      public void deleteRequest​(Request requestToDelete) throws Exception
      Deletes a request from the computed tour. Tests if the request is correct. Then removes the pickup stop and the delivery stop of the request from the computed tour, and updates the tour (new paths instead of the former stops + recalculate the arrival times).
      Parameters:
      requestToDelete - The request to delete from the computed tour.
      Throws:
      Exception - If the request is null.
      See Also:
      computeShortestPath(Stop, ArrayList), Stop, Path, Tour, Tour.getOrderedTravel(), Tour.computeArrivalTimes()
